subject: Re: [junit] Converting Oracle's dialect of SQL to HSQLDB?
msgSnippet: ... I personally wouldn t bother. The differences in behaviour between Oracle and HSQLDB would make the tests somewhat worthless... What I would do instead is
messageBody:
John Lindwall wrote:
> I'm becoming curious about HSQLDB (and other in-memory databases). Our
> growing body of DBUnit-based tests are taking longer and longer to run
> and I feel it's hurting quality.
>
> Cavaet: I am not a database/SQL expert
>
> I installed hsqldb and tried to run our DDL file that creates our
> unit-test database against it. We use Oracle for test/production now.
> The DDL is riddled with Oracle-specific cruft: NUMBER instead of
> INTEGER, VARCHAR2 vs VARCHAR, etc.
>
> Is there an easy way to take a DDL file like this and convert it into a
> format that HSQLDB will grok? We currently use TOAD to generate the DDL
> file BTW if that matters.

I personally wouldn't bother. The differences in behaviour between Oracle
and HSQLDB would make the tests somewhat worthless...

What I would do instead is aim at having a core number of integration tests
which test a well-defined facade over the database, along with lots of unit
tests which use an in-memory version of the facade. For bonus points: make
the unit tests have a pluggable facade, so you can run them against the
database instead overnight.

Robert.
